availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County Court of Ohio County Sct
October Term 1862

Ordered that John Stevens be accd he is hereby recommended to the Govenor of this Commonwealth as a Suitable person to fill the vacancy of Justice of the Peace in District No 7 in view of D. S. Hill resigned: and also John D. Miller to fill a Similar vacancy in Disctrict No. 1 of this County in view of E. Mitchell Resigned

A Copy Attest --
R. J. Moseley Cl'k O, C, C,
N. B. If the Govenor makes the within appointments the Secretary of State will please send Commissions to me at Hartford --

Ohio Co.
J. P.
Dist No 1 & 7
Issd Octo 30 1862
